intro: Alibrexia gayana, commonly known as the golden bell orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Alibrexia gayana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
